actions: A blizzard of cuts round various news reports, fast, just snatched words and phrases --

location: Various news studios and war zone

dialogue.speaker: BBC NEWSREADER
dialogue.text: -- increased hostilities over the last few weeks --

actions: Video phone shows chaotic, accidental footage of a dirt road, a crashed jeep belching smoke, gunfire, and soldiers running.

dialogue.speaker: ELLA
dialogue.text: You haven’t written a word, have you?

dialogue.speaker: JOHN
dialogue.text: You just wrote “still has trust issues”.

dialogue.speaker: ELLA
dialogue.text: And you read my writing upside down.  See what I mean?

dialogue.speaker: ELLA
dialogue.text: John, you’re a soldier.  It’s going to take you a while to adjust to civilian life - writing a blog about everything that happens to you, will honestly help you.  Trust me.

actions: John wakes up, sweating in his bed.
John frowns at the walking cane.
John sets down a coffee cup on the desk.
John opens a drawer and removes a laptop computer.
John looks at a hand gun in the drawer.
John opens a blog page on the laptop.
John sits stiffly in his chair in the therapist's consulting room.

emotions: John is resentful towards the walking cane.
John is tempted by the gun.
